name: Epoxy; at plant
description: This gate-to-gate unit process is for the production of 1 kg epoxy. The modeled system is only representative of key material and energy inputs required to produce epoxy. Exchanges associated with production capital are not modeled. Production inventory data were developed using GREET 2019.
category: 31-33: Manufacturing/3252: Resin, Synthetic Rubber, and Artificial and Synthetic Fibers and Filaments Manufacturing

processDocumentation.timeDescription: The inventory is representative of average epoxy production in 2019.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: This process is representative of average epoxy production under US conditions.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: The inventory is representative of average technological conditions for the manufacturing of epoxy.
processDocumentation.inventoryMethodDescription: An attributional LCI method was used to develop the dataset.
processDocumentation.modelingConstantsDescription: This process was adapted from inventory data developed by Argonne National Laboratory.
processDocumentation.completenessDescription:
TREATMENT OF MISSING ENVIRONMENTAL DATA: It is unknown whether a cutoff for elementary flows was used in the original study.



TREATMENT OF MISSING TECHNOSPHERE FLOWS: 
It is unknown whether a cutoff for technosphere flows was used in the original study. Missing technosphere flows are unknown.



MASS BALANCE: 
The mass imbalance for this unit process is unknown.
processDocumentation.dataSelectionDescription: Data for the production of epoxy were collected and adapted from the original study by Argonne National Laboratory.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Source inventory data were allocated to the production of 1 kg epoxy.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Data for the production of epoxy were collected and adapted from GREET 2019. The original study was developed as average production data for the US.
processDocumentation.intendedApplication: Situation C2 - Accounting (no external benefits): The intended application for this process is for accounting purposes as described in Goal Situation C1 from the ILCD Handbook's Detailed Guidance. LCA studies with this intended application offer "purely descriptive documentation of the system under analysis (e.g., a product, sector or country), without being interested in any potential consequences on other parts of the economy.‚Äù The studies categorized under Goal Situation C2 do NOT consider existing benefits outside the analyzed system such as recycling.
processDocumentation.projectDescription: Original data collection was performed by Argonne National Laboratory and was adapted by the National Renewable Energy Laboratory.

dataDocumentor.name: Franklin Associates, A Division of ERG
